answers.answer: Ok I googled it and came up with "visual snow" if that helps any...

My doc said to mention any visual changes I have, but that some blurriness is normal due to increase of blood flow and what not. If it keeps happening, or lasts for.more than a few hours I'd call your doctor. I had blurriness a lot early in my second trimester but then it disappeared.
It's not blurriness though. It looks like rainbow colored static.

My vision has gotten worse with pregnancy. Doesnt help that I sit in front of a computer 8+ hours a day at work. I bought some reading glasses at CVS to help for when it gets really bad. My doc said it should go back to normal after the baby is born

It could have been a sudden change in blood pressure, standing up too quickly.... Are you getting headaches with this? What I would do since you state that it sometimes lasts a while and it is difficult to see, is to call your doctor and tell them everything that's going on. It could be nothing but some changes during pregnancy or it could be something that needs to be looked at.
It sounds like a migraine "aura" without the migraine following,  which I had when i was pregnant.
No postural changes. Just random times.
How far along are you? I had floaters a lot in my first trimester.

Actually now that you mention it I had the same thing at the beginning of my pregnancy before i even knew I was pregnant. I have three other kids and my hubby works on the road so I thought I was just overly tired but I bet it did have to do with blood pressure changes.
U need to let ur doc no so he/she can make sure its not preeclampsia witch is a serious condition in pregnancys....

question: Anyone else having problems with your vision? Every once in a while I will get what seems like colored spots and sort of foggy vision. Not really blurry, more like static, but it is difficult to see. I am typing this now as my vision is impaired but it is not easy to type this. It will sometimes last for as long as a few hours. Is this normal?
title: vision problems
